readme-backup.markdown:
# Minimal Rust Backend framework

This is just me trying to make a minimal Backend framework for the Rust programming language, which I chose as my first Rust project to challenge myself.
readme-backup.name: Title and Description

readme-backup.markdown:
## Installation

Install my-project with npm

```bash
  npm install my-project
  cd my-project
```
readme-backup.name: Installation

readme-backup.markdown:
## Run Locally

Clone the project

```bash
  git clone https://link-to-project
```

Go to the project directory

```bash
  cd my-project
```

Install dependencies

```bash
  npm install
```

Start the server

```bash
  npm run start
```
readme-backup.name: Run Locally

readme-backup.markdown:
## Environment Variables

To run this project, you will need to add the following environment variables to your .env file

`API_KEY`

`ANOTHER_API_KEY`
readme-backup.name: Environment Variables

readme-backup.markdown:
## Features

- Adding Routes
- Returning Strings
- Getting query path
- Getting raw request body
- Getting request headers and method
readme-backup.name: Features

readme-backup.markdown:
## Usage/Examples

```javascript
import Component from 'my-project'

function App() {
  return <Component />
}
```
readme-backup.name: Usage/Examples

readme-backup.markdown:
## API Reference

#### Get all items

```http
GET /api/items
```

| Parameter | Type     | Description                |
| :-------- | :------- | :------------------------- |
| `api_key` | `string` | **Required**. Your API key |

#### Get item

```http
GET /api/items/${id}
```

| Parameter | Type     | Description                       |
| :-------- | :------- | :-------------------------------- |
| `id`      | `string` | **Required**. Id of item to fetch |
readme-backup.name: API Reference

readme-backup.markdown:
## Running Tests

To run tests, run the following command

```bash
cargo test
```
readme-backup.name: Running Tests
